plenty.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough
plenty.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: There are plenty more chairs in the next room.
There’s plenty to do and see in New York.
Make sure she gets plenty of fresh air.
No need to hurry – you’ve got plenty of time.
plenty.translation[0].definitions[0].not: You use plenty of before an uncountable noun
There is plenty of evidence that he is guilty
There is a plenty of evidence
You also use plenty of before a plural noun
There are plenty of opportunities to improve your skills
You say that something has plenty of a thing, quality etc
The town has plenty of nightlife
The town is plenty of nightlife
plenty.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a situation in which there is a lot of food and goods available for people
